title: Mystery of Women in a Medieval Cemetery
summary: Archaeologists in Wales are trying to solve a mystery about women buried in a medieval cemetery. They found 58 skeletons from the 6th or 7th century, and almost all are women. The team discovered a small building outline, beads, and other items that show the women might have been part of a religious community. The graves are shallow and cut into rock, and people wanted to be buried near the building, sometimes sharing graves. This helps us learn about life long ago and who these women were.

background_read: In medieval times, around 1,500 years ago, people lived differently than today. Archaeologists dig up old sites to find clues about how they lived, what they believed, and who they were. This helps us understand history and solve mysteries from the past.
